qas.question: How many different species of plant life are known to grow in London?
How many National Nature Reserves exist in the London area?
Green space and open water comprises what percent of London?
How many species of fish live in the River Thames?
The London Natural History Society has document how many species of butterfly?

context: The London Natural History Society suggest that London is "one of the World's Greenest Cities" with <a2_0>more than 40 percent<a2_0/> green space or open water. They indicate that <a0_0>2000<a0_0/> species of flowering plant have been found growing there and that the tidal Thames supports <a3_0>120<a3_0/> species of fish. They also state that over 60 species of bird nest in central London and that their members have recorded <a4_0>47<a4_0/> species of butterfly, 1173 moths and more than 270 kinds of spider around London. London's wetland areas support nationally important populations of many water birds. London has 38 Sites of Special Scientific Interest (SSSIs), <a1_0>two<a1_0/> National Nature Reserves and 76 Local Nature Reserves.
